"Doc" Foglesong''' ([[United States Air Force|USAF]], Ret.) (born July 13, 1945),[http://www.defense.gov/releases/release.aspx?releaseid=1356] formerly of [[Williamson, West Virginia]], is a former President of Mississippi State University. He served in the [[United States Air Force]] from April 1972 until retirement as general in February 2006. ==Education== Foglesong earned the degrees BSc, MSc and PhD at [[West Virginia University]] in chemical engineering in 1968, 1969 and 1971 respectively. He holds an [[Honorary degree|honorary Doctorate]] in Strategic Intelligence, and is a Distinguished Alumnus of West Virginia University.[http://alumni.wvu.edu/awards/academy/ WVU Alumni | Academy of Distinguished Alumni] He was selected by the West Virginia Education Alliance as a Graduate of Distinction,[http://www.educationalliance.org/Giving/2003Graduates.htm Home Page] and was selected by the West Virginia Executive Magazine as the Patriot of the Year for 2005.[http://www.wvexecutive.com/videolibrary/honor-awards-2005/index.php Honor Awards Gala 2005 : Video Library : West Virginia Executive] ==Air Force career== Foglesong attained the rank of four-star general in the [[United States Air Force]] 5 November 2001, retiring 1 February 2006 from active duty after 33 years of service. His last post was as Commander of U.S. Air Forces in Europe and of Allied Air Component Command Ramstein where the service's enlisted corps honored him with the [[Order of the Sword (United States)|Order of the Sword]].[http://www.af.mil/news/story.asp?storyID=123011533 General McNabb inducted into AMC Order of the Sword], 9/7/2007 General Foglesong commanded six times during his Air Force service including flying and maintenance units, a Numbered Air Force, and a Major Command. During his final command, General Foglesong continued his established model of using multiple "Combat" programs throughout his command to focus on military discipline and service standards including facilities maintenance, physical readiness, and leadership and mentoring. Some Airmen chaffed under these "Combat" Programs while others saw merit and value in the renewed emphasis on pride, espirit, and mission. Shortly after his retirement, his successor led an effort to reshape these programs begun under Foglesong, dropping two programs and delegating responsibility for 10 of the programs to base and wing commanders.Scott Schonauer, [http://www.stripes.com/news/combat-shifts-usafe-programs-to-be-retooled-1.47310 'Combat' shifts: USAFE programs to be retooled], April 5, 2006, [[Stars and Stripes |[[SICOFAA Legion of Merit Medal|SICOFAA Legion of Merit, Officer]] |} ==After retirement== Foglesong was President of [[Mississippi State University]] from 2006 to 31 March 2008. Foglesong was the second retired general to hold the office of president at the university; [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] [[Lieutenant General (CSA)|lieutenant general]] [[Stephen D. Lee]] was the first. Foglesong tackled a number of competing internal and external agendas that he saw as undermining the school's purpose of delivering a quality education to its students.[http://www.reflector-online.com/news/president-responds-to-faculty-criticism-1.1778857] Under pressure from politicians, students and faculty,http://www.stripes.com/news/former-usafe-boss-quits-university-post-as-complaints-mount-1.76355 he resigned in March 2008. During his tenure enrollment rose 6% from 16,206 [http://www.msstate.edu/web/media/detail.php?id=3902] to 17,127 in 2008.[http://www.ir.msstate.edu/enroll_profile08.pdf] He also oversaw a significant change to the school's facilitites and grounds involving removal of longstanding traditional landscaping[http://www.msstate.edu/web/media/detail.php?id=4132 MSU landscape involves constant maintenance, replacement], February 11, 2008 including removal of daffodil bulbs which had been on the campus for decades.[http://www.msstate.edu/web/media/detail.php?id=3637] Much of this landscaping was seen as destructive and shortsighted in nature by students and faculty.http://www.picayuneitem.com/local/x2079276971/Removal-of-popular-yellow-flowers-at-MSU-upsetting-some/print Foglesong founded a scholarship program in West Virginia called the Appalachian Leadership and Educational Foundation in 2006. He helped to establish the Appalachian Leadership Honors Program at Mississippi State, which now goes by the name Montgomery Leadership Program in honor of former congressman [[Gillespie V. Montgomery|Sonny Montgomery]] in 2006.http://www.alhp.msstate.edu/learn_more/http://www.flyingsquadron.com/forums/index.php?/topic/13965-the-foglesong-thread/ He has also served as a director of now defunct [[Massey Energy]], a major coal company which closed after flagrant safety violations during his tenure.{{cite news | url=http://online.wsj.com/article/SB10001424052970204770404577082341518182150.html | title=Feds Blame Owner of West Virginia Mine | publisher=Wall Street Journal | date=December 6, 2011 | accessdate=December 6, 2011 | last1=Maher | first1=Kris}}{{cite press_release | url=http://www.msha.gov/MEDIA/PRESS/2011/NR111206.asp | title=US Labor Department's MSHA cites corporate culture as root cause of Upper Big Branch Mine disaster: Massey issued 369 citations and orders with $10.8 million in civil penalties | publisher=Mine Safety and Health Administration | date=December 6, 2011 | accessdate=December 6, 2011}}{{cite press_release | url=http://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/2011/December/11-ag-1577.html | title=Alpha Natural Resources Inc. and Department of Justice Reach $209 Million Agreement Related to Upper Big Branch Mine Explosion | publisher=US Dept. of Justice | date=December 6, 2011 | accessdate=December 6, 2011}}[http://phx.corporate-ir.net/phoenix.zhtml?c=102864&p=irol-govBio&ID=148259] ==See also== {{Portal|United States Air Force}} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.af.mil/bios/bio.asp?bioID=5435 Air Force Biography] *[http://www.flyingsquadron.com/forums/index.php?/topic/13965-the-foglesong-thread/page__hl__fogelsong__st__20] *[http://i38.tinypic.com/2zg8121.jpg] *[http://www.reflector-online.com/2.13177/doc-resigns-to-help-university-move-forward-1.1778498] * http://www.stripes.com/news/combat-shifts-usafe-programs-to-be-retooled-1.47310 {{s-start}} {{s-mil}} {{Succession box|before = [[John W.
